articles.title: AI journalism startup Symbolic.ai signs deal with Rupert Murdoch’s News Corp
articles.summary: The startup claims its AI platform can help optimize editorial processes and research.

articles.title: The AI lab revolving door spins ever faster
articles.summary: AI labs just can't get their employees to stay put. Yesterday’s big AI news was the abrupt and seemingly acrimonious departure of three top executives at Mira Murati’s Thinking Machines lab.

articles.title: Taiwan to invest $250B in US semiconductor manufacturing
articles.summary: The U.S. struck a trade deal with Taiwan as the country looks to help boost domestic semiconductor manufacturing.

articles.title: AI video startup, Higgsfield, founded by ex-Snap exec, lands $1.3B valuation
articles.summary: Higgsfield says it's on a $200 million annual revenue run rate. So it opened its previous Series A round back up and sold another $80 million in shares.

articles.title: The US imposes 25% tariff on Nvidia’s H200 AI chips headed to China
articles.summary: The Trump administration formalized its 25% cut of H200 chip sales in China with a tariff that applies to certain semiconductors.

articles.title: OpenAI invests in Sam Altman’s brain computer interface startup Merge Labs
articles.summary: Merge Labs is a “research lab” dedicated to “bridging biological and artificial intelligence to maximize human ability.” OpenAI wrote the largest check in Merge Labs' $250 million seed round at an $850 million valuation.

articles.title: Wikimedia Foundation announces new AI partnerships with Amazon, Meta, Microsoft, Perplexity, and others
articles.summary: The AI partnerships allow companies to access the org's content, like Wikipedia, at scale.

articles.title: Parloa triples its valuation in 8 months to $3B with $350M raise
articles.summary: The massive round was led by existing investor General Catalyst, with participation from other returning backers.

articles.title: After Italy, WhatsApp excludes Brazil from rival chatbot ban
articles.summary: WhatsApp is allowing AI providers to continue offering their chatbots to users in Brazil, days after the country's competition agency ordered the company to suspend its new policy that bars third-party, general-purpose chatbots from the app.

articles.title: Grok undressed the mother of one of Elon Musk’s kids — and now she’s suing
articles.summary: Ashley St. Clair, the mother of one of X owner Elon Musk's children, is suing his company for enabling its AI to virtually strip her down into a bikini without her consent. St. Clair is one of the many people over the past couple weeks who have found themselves undressed without permission by X's AI […]
